name: DAV National Service Office - Phoenix VA Regional Office
description: Free counseling and assistance navigating VA benefits, filing service-connected disability compensation claims, and appeals. DAV National Service Officers explain how the VA establishes disability ratings and provide comprehensive claims support at no cost to veterans.
address: 3333 N Central Ave, Suite 1053, Phoenix, AZ 85012
hours: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, Friday 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM
notes: Located inside VA Phoenix Regional Office. National Service Officers are accredited by the VA.

name: American Legion Veteran Service Officer - Phoenix
organization: The American Legion, Department of Arizona
description: Accredited Veteran Service Officers provide free assistance with VA benefits claims, appeals, and applications. Help veterans navigate the VA benefits system and file claims for disability compensation, pension, education, and other VA benefits.
address: 3333 N Central Ave, Suite 1048, Phoenix, AZ 85012
notes: Located at VA Phoenix Regional Office. VSOs are accredited by the VA and American Legion.

name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services - Veteran Benefits Counselors
description: State-employed Veteran Benefits Counselors (VBCs) who are fellow veterans and civilians, accredited by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs and American Legion. Provide assistance with applying for state and federal benefits for veterans and their families.
address: 3333 N Central Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85012
notes: Schedule appointments at http://bit.ly/ADVSBenefits or call. VBCs are accredited by VA and American Legion.

name: Phoenix Vet Center - Benefits Assistance
description: Provides information on how to get VA Medical benefits and sign up for care. Connects veterans with VSOs for filing claims and other benefit documents. Staff can connect clients to representatives for VA education, VA and state burial benefits, and VA home loans benefits.
address: 4020 North 20th Street, Suite 110, Phoenix, AZ 85016
hours: Monday 7:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Tuesday 7:30 AM - 5:30 PM, Wednesday 7:00 AM - 5:30 PM, Thursday 7:30 AM - 5:30 PM, Friday 7:00 AM - 4:30 PM
notes: No VA enrollment or service-connected disability rating required. Services available in-person or via phone/video. Non-traditional hours available by calling. 24/7 crisis support: 877-927-8387 or 988 (press 1).

name: VA Phoenix Regional Office - Public Contact Team
description: Administers VA benefits including disability compensation, pension, burial allowances, survivor benefits, education, insurance, and veteran readiness and employment. Provides counseling about eligibility for VA benefits and how to apply. Walk-ins welcome or schedule appointments through VERA portal.
address: 3333 North Central Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85012
notes: Walk-ins welcome. Appointments encouraged through VERA self-service portal. Veterans Crisis Line: 988 (Press 1).

name: Maricopa County Be Connected
organization: Maricopa County Human Services / Be Connected
description: Support line connecting veterans with essential resources including housing, employment services, job placement, senior and adult services, legal assistance, and other county programs. Initial screening and resource identification for veterans and families.
address: 301 West Jefferson Street, Phoenix, AZ 85003
notes: Call 866-4AZ-VETS for initial screening. Check eligibility for county programs at Maricopa.gov/ApplyForHelp. Since July 2023, has assisted 1,100+ veterans.

name: Bexar County Military and Veterans Services Center
organization: Bexar County Department of Military and Veterans Services
description: Officially established advocate agency providing VA benefits claims assistance, discharge upgrades, employment and transition support. VSO-certified and VSO-accredited staff. All services free.
address: 1422 E. Grayson St., 4th Floor, San Antonio, TX 78208
services: Outreach to homeless and incarcerated veterans
hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM, 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM (By appointment only)
notes: Staff includes George Westfahl, Claudia Moreno, Gilbert Lauriano, and Kendra Cook. Best GPS access: 923 E. Carson St, San Antonio, TX 78208 due to construction.

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) Alamo 5 - San Antonio
description: Accredited VA claims assistance organization. Helps eligible veterans and families with VA disability claims, discharge upgrades, and connection to healthcare, education, and financial benefits.
address: 6401 Wenzel Road, San Antonio, TX 78233
hours: Monday-Tuesday, Thursday-Friday 7:30 AM - 4:00 PM; Wednesday 7:30 AM - 11:30 AM
coverage_area: Atascosa, Bandera, Bexar, Comal, Frio, Gillespie, Guadalupe, Karnes, Kendall, Kerr, Medina, Wilson Counties
notes: Accredited organization. DAV membership not required. Email: dav.alamo5sa@gmail.com

name: San Antonio Legal Services Association (SALSA) - Veterans Legal Clinic
description: Provides free limited legal advice and counsel to low-income veterans and their families on civil legal matters including VA benefits, discharge upgrades, housing, contracts, and estate planning.
address: P.O. Box 12404, San Antonio, TX 78212
hours: Monthly clinics - second Friday of each month 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM at Veterans Outreach and Transition Center (202 Connelly Street, San Antonio, TX 78203)
notes: Low-income eligibility required. Must complete application. Cannot assist with criminal charges, traffic tickets, personal injury, or workers compensation.

name: Texas RioGrande Legal Aid (TRLA) - San Antonio Veterans Ask-A-Lawyer Clinic
description: Free civil legal assistance for eligible veterans, widows, spouses, and active service members. Specializes in housing, VA benefits, HUD-VASH, SSI, SNAP, Medicaid, and estate planning.
address: Audie L. Murphy VA Medical Center, 7400 Merton Minter Boulevard, 3rd Floor Room D302, San Antonio, TX 78229
notes: Located at VA medical center. Income-based eligibility applies. Also serves widows and spouses of veterans.

name: VFW Post 76 - Sam Houston Post
description: Historic VFW post (oldest in Texas, chartered 1917) providing veteran benefits assistance, honor guard services, scholarships, and community outreach. Assists with VA benefits and pension resources.
address: 10 10th Street, San Antonio, TX 78215

docs_required: Campaign medals or proof of foreign service

hours: Tuesday-Thursday 4:00 PM - 12:00 AM; Friday-Saturday 12:00 PM - 2:00 AM; Sunday 12:00 PM - 12:00 AM; Closed Monday
notes: Oldest VFW post in Texas. Located near Riverwalk. Membership eligibility: honorable service plus foreign service or hostile waters/fire.

name: Dallas County Veteran Services Office
description: County-level advocate agency providing comprehensive VA benefits assistance including disability compensation claims, pension claims, DIC claims, appeals, and state benefits consultation
address: 2377 N. Stemmons Freeway, Suite 631, Dallas, TX 75207-2710
services: Outreach to shut-in and homeless veterans
notes: Operating by appointments only. Accredited VSO with multiple certifications. Provides consultation prior to VA submission to help reduce delays.

name: Dallas Vet Center
description: VA-operated counseling and resource center providing readjustment services and benefits referrals with confidential records
address: 8610 Greenville Avenue, Suite 125, Dallas, TX 75243
notes: 24/7 hotline: 877-927-8387. Confidential records not shared with other VA offices. No discharge status requirement.

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) Oak Cliff Chapter 32
description: Accredited VSO providing free professional assistance with VA disability claims and benefits navigation
address: 1408 Ferndale Avenue, Dallas, TX 75224
hours: 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM on 2nd Saturday of each month
notes: Limited hours - primarily open 2nd Saturday. DAV membership not required. National Service Officers are accredited representatives.

name: American Legion Post 53 (John Low-Joe Smartt Post 53)
description: Accredited American Legion service officers providing free VA benefits assistance and claims support
address: 10205 Plano Road, Suite 104, Dallas, TX 75238
hours: Call for service officer availability; Meetings 2nd Saturday 1:00 PM
notes: Accredited American Legion service officers. Membership not required for assistance. Email: Americanlegionp53@gmail.com

name: VFW Post 6796 (John Franklin Sprague Post 6796)
description: Accredited VFW service officers providing free VA claims and benefits assistance
address: 9179 Garland Road, Dallas, TX 75218
hours: 12:00 PM (noon) - closing time, 7 days a week; Service officer hours by inquiry
notes: VFW accredited service officers available. VFW membership not required. Located in East Dallas.

name: Texas Veterans Commission Claims Department
description: State-level claims advisors providing VA benefits assistance and representation for disability claims and appeals
address: Multiple regional offices; serves all of Texas
notes: Claims Benefit Advisors are all veterans. Available statewide. TVC also maintains contact with local VSO resources.

name: Harris County Veterans Services Department
description: Free VA benefits claim consultations with qualified Veteran Service Officers (VSOs). Assistance with compensation, pension, medical, educational, insurance, and death benefits claims. Help obtaining important documentation for VA applications.
address: 2100 Travis Suite 210, Houston, TX 77002
notes: Serves Harris County, which has the largest veteran population in Texas. Funded through Texas Veterans Commission.

name: Houston VA Regional Benefit Office
description: Federal VA benefits office providing counseling on eligibility, VA health care, disability compensation, education benefits, home loans, and memorial benefits. Benefit counselors help understand eligibility, gather documents, fill out paperwork, and check claim status.
address: 6900 Almeda Road, Houston, TX 77030

docs_required: Medical records if applying for disability

services: Outreach to homeless and at-risk veterans
hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 3:30 PM (Closed Saturday-Sunday, Lunch 12:00-12:30 PM)
notes: Schedule appointments through VERA at https://va.my.site.com/VAVERA/s/. Free parking available. Virtual visits available for many services.

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) - Houston Office
description: Accredited DAV National Service Officers provide free assistance with VA disability compensation claims, appeals, pension, vocational rehabilitation, education benefits, home loan guaranty, life insurance, and death benefits.
address: 6900 Almeda Road, Room 1033, Houston, TX 77030
notes: Accredited VSO housed at VA Regional Office. DAV also has Mobile Service Offices (MSO) that travel to rural areas. National hotline: 877-426-2838 (877-I-AM-A-VET).

name: American Legion - Houston Regional Office
description: American Legion Department Service Officer providing free assistance to veterans and families with VA benefits, claims filing, eligibility questions, and related services. Membership not required.
address: 6900 Almeda Road, Room 1019, Houston, TX 77030
notes: Service Officer: Mike Lacy (michael.lacy@va.gov). Housed at VA Regional Office. Membership in American Legion not required for service.

name: American Legion Post 490 (South Houston)
description: Local American Legion post with service officer assistance for veteran benefits claims and counseling. The largest Legion post by membership in Texas.
address: 11702 Old Galveston Road, Houston, TX 77034
notes: Largest American Legion post in Texas. Contact directly for current service officer name and specific hours of operation.

name: VFW Post 8790 (Spring Branch Houston)
description: VFW post with accredited service officers providing free assistance with VA claims process. One of Houston's oldest and strongest veteran organizations.
address: 1560 VFW Way, Houston, TX 77055
notes: VFW accredited service officers provide free assistance (membership not required). Contact post directly at vfwpost8790@gmail.com or phone for specific hours and service officer details.

name: Texas Veterans Commission - Houston Office
description: State agency providing VA claims representation and assistance. Helps veterans file state and federal benefit claims.
address: 6900 Almeda Road, Room 1053, Houston, TX 77030
notes: State agency located at VA Regional Office. Toll-free number: 888-838-8391. Main office: 512-364-7048.

name: City of Houston Office of Veterans and Military Affairs
description: City office providing veteran resources, benefits assistance, and connections to military support programs. Offers information and referrals for veteran services.
address: 901 Bagby, Legacy Room Offices, Houston, TX 77002
notes: Email: movma@houstontx.gov. Part of Department of Neighborhoods. Also coordinates airport parking benefits for veterans with qualifying license plates.

name: AMVETS - Houston Regional Office
description: AMVETS provides veteran benefits counseling and claims assistance through accredited service officers.
address: 6900 Almeda Road, Room 1042, Houston, TX 77030
notes: Housed at VA Regional Office. AMVETS is an accredited VSO providing free services to all veterans.

name: Paralyzed Veterans of America (PVA) - Houston Office
description: Specialized VSO providing assistance to veterans with spinal cord injury and dysfunction, including benefits counseling and disability claims support.
address: 6900 Almeda Road, Room 1028, Houston, TX 77030
notes: Specialized VSO for spinal cord injury veterans. Housed at VA Regional Office. Free services to all veterans with qualifying service-connected disabilities.

name: VA Regional Office - Public Contact Office
description: Official VA office providing disability compensation claims assistance, benefit counseling, claim status checks, and direct deposit updates. No appointment needed for walk-in assistance.
address: Dennis Chavez Federal Building, 500 Gold Avenue SW, Albuquerque, NM 87102
hours: Monday-Friday 9:00 AM - 2:30 PM (walk-in), appointments available via VERA
coverage_area: Albuquerque and surrounding Bernalillo County area
notes: Located in Dennis Chavez Federal Building with multiple VSOs in separate rooms. Veterans can walk in without appointment or schedule virtual/in-person appointments via VERA.

name: NM Department of Veterans Services - Albuquerque Field Office (Indian School Road)
organization: New Mexico Department of Veterans Services
description: State-accredited Veterans Service Officers assisting with federal VA claims and state veteran benefits. All VSOs are veterans themselves and nationally accredited.
address: 4801 Indian School Road NE, Building 2, Suite 2, Albuquerque, NM 87110
coverage_area: Bernalillo County and all of New Mexico
notes: NMDVS has 16 field offices statewide. Recommend calling ahead to schedule appointment. All VSOs are accredited through National Association of County Veteran Service Officers.

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) - Albuquerque Office
description: Accredited VSO organization providing free assistance with VA disability claims, appeals, and other veteran benefits. DAV has served veterans since 1920.
address: 2309 Renard Place SE, Suite 208, Albuquerque, NM 87106
notes: All DAV services are provided free of charge. DAV also offers non-claims assistance including food and emergency funding. Founded in 1920.

name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) - Department Service Office
description: Accredited national VSO assisting with VA disability compensation claims, pension claims, appeals, and benefit paperwork. Free claims assistance for all veterans.
address: 500 Gold Avenue SW, Suite 3104, Albuquerque, NM 87102
notes: Located in Dennis Chavez Federal Building alongside other VSOs. Contact Kaitlin Jaramillo at kaitlin.jaramillo@va.gov for claims assistance.

name: American Legion - Department Service Office
description: Accredited national VSO providing free assistance with VA disability claims, pension benefits, and other veteran benefits. Long-established organization serving veterans.
address: 500 Gold Avenue SW, Room 3102, Albuquerque, NM 87102
notes: Located in Dennis Chavez Federal Building with other VSOs. American Legion provides comprehensive veteran services and advocacy.

name: AMVETS - National Service Office
description: Accredited national VSO assisting with VA disability claims and veteran benefits. AMVETS has experienced service officers serving throughout New Mexico.
address: 500 Gold Avenue SW, Room 3004, Albuquerque, NM 87102
notes: Located in Dennis Chavez Federal Building. National Service Officer Louis Rossi serves AMVETS Region 4.

name: Paralyzed Veterans of America (PVA) - Albuquerque Office
description: Accredited VSO specializing in service-connected disability claims, particularly for spinal cord and traumatic brain injuries. Free claims assistance available.
address: 500 Gold Avenue SW, Room 3111, Albuquerque, NM 87102
notes: Located in Dennis Chavez Federal Building. Specializes in representing veterans with spinal cord injuries and traumatic brain injuries.

name: Nevada Department of Veterans Services - North Las Vegas Office
description: State accredited Veterans Service Officers providing comprehensive claim preparation, filing, and appeals assistance for VA benefits
address: 6900 N. Pecos Rd., Room 1C238, North Las Vegas, NV 89086
notes: Located at VA Hospital complex. Also reachable at 702-791-9000 ext. 46025

name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) - Sunrise Mountain Chapter 13
description: Accredited DAV National Service Officers providing expert VA claims assistance, benefits counseling, and appeals support at no cost
address: 3325 N Nellis Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89115
hours: Meetings 4th Tuesday of month at 7:00 PM
notes: National Service Officers provide benefits assistance regardless of DAV membership. Also accessible at 6900 N. Pecos Rd location

name: VFW Post 3848 - Service Officer Assistance
description: VFW Service Officers providing free VA claims assistance and benefits counseling to help veterans file VA claims and appeals
address: 401 W. Lake Mead Pkwy, Henderson, NV 89015
hours: Walk-in service: Tuesdays 9am-4pm. General hours: Monday-Friday 2:30pm-9:00pm
notes: Walk-in Service Officers available Tuesdays only. VFW membership not required

name: VFW Post 10047 - North Las Vegas Memorial Post
description: Accredited VFW Service Officers offering free VA claims assistance and benefits counseling to all veterans
address: 4337 Las Vegas Blvd N, Las Vegas, NV 89115
hours: Meetings every 3rd Tuesday at 6:00 PM (check for service officer hours)
notes: Administrative office also at 4904 Camino Al Norte, North Las Vegas, NV 89033. Service officers available by appointment

name: American Legion Post 8 - Service Officer
description: Accredited American Legion Service Officers providing expert VA claims assistance and benefits counseling at no cost to veterans and families
address: 733 Veterans Memorial Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89101
hours: Contact for current service officer hours
notes: Accredited American Legion service officers offer expert assistance at no cost. Membership not required

name: VA Southern Nevada Regional Benefits Office
description: Federal VA office providing direct veteran benefits administration, claims processing, and benefits counseling
address: 6900 N. Pecos Rd., North Las Vegas, NV 89086
notes: Part of North Las Vegas VA Medical Center complex. Walk-ins accepted except federal holidays
